description: Silky wormwood (Artemisia frigida) is an incredible ornamental shrub found in semi-arid climates like its native North America. This plant features grey-green, deeply cut foliage that produces little yellow flowers in the summer. It thrives in dry, poor soils and requires little maintenance once established. Its distinct silvery leaves make it an ornamental species on which pollinators like butterflies and bees love to feed. In addition, silky wormwood is known to have strong essential oil components making it a useful medicinal species. Versatile and wonderfully attractive, silky wormwood is the perfect addition to any landscape.
